positions.description: • Aligns business objectives with employees and management in designated regional communities. • Consults with management, providing HR guidance when appropriate. • Analyzes trends and metrics in partnership with the HR group to develop solutions, programs, and procedures. • Manages and resolves complex employee relations issues. Conducts effective, thorough, and objective investigations. • Maintains in-depth knowledge of legal requirements related to day-to-day management of employees, reducing legal risks and ensuring regulatory compliance. • Provides day-to-day performance management guidance to management, such as coaching, counselling, career development, and disciplinary actions. • Works closely with management to improve work relationships, build morale, and increase productivity and retention. • Provides guidance and input on community restructures, and workforce planning and succession • Oversees Workers Compensation, FMLA, and all leaves of absence • Identifies training needs for community and individual executive coaching needs • Participates in evaluation and monitoring of training programs to ensure success. Follows up to ensure training objectives are met. • Manages community recruitment needs, develops relationships with organizations and schools regarding placement programs. • Provides HR policy guidance and interpretation

detailed_profile.position: Human Resources Manager - Australia & New Zealand at Capri Holdings Limited
detailed_profile.about: Trusted HR leader in a complex global business; successfully managing stakeholders and competing priorities across regions to deliver organisational change and significant growth in ANZ. I diligently align & adapt global objectives and strategy to ensure compliance with Australia & New Zealand legislation. My passion lies in coaching and promoting ideas for business growth and value-add initiatives with the aim to create a unique and impactful people experience.

current_company.name: Capri Holdings Limited
current_company.title: Human Resources Manager, Australia & New Zealand

experience.title: Human Resources Manager, Australia & New Zealand
experience.description:
Head of Human Resources function for Australia & New Zealand.


-	Collaborate with executive team to understand the organisation's goals and strategy related to staffing, recruiting, and retention.

-	Plan, lead and develop policies, processes, training, and initiatives to support the organisation's human resource compliance and strategy needs.

-	Administer and oversee the administration of human resource programs including, but not limited to, compensation, benefits, and leave; disciplinary matters; disputes and investigations; performance and talent management; productivity, recognition, and morale; work health and safety; and training and development.

-	Identify staffing and recruiting needs; develops and executes best practices for hiring and talent management.

-	Conduct research and analysis of organisational trends including review of reports and metrics from the organization's human resource information system (HRIS) – Workday

-	Monitor and ensure the organisation's compliance with federal, state, and local employment laws and regulations, and recommended best practices; review and modify policies and practices to maintain compliance.

-	Maintain knowledge of trends, best practices, regulatory changes, and apply this knowledge to communicate changes in policy, practice, and resources to upper management and ANZ team

-	Develop and implement departmental budget.

-	Facilitate professional development, training, and certification activities for all ANZ team
experience.description_html:
Head of Human Resources function for Australia & New Zealand.

- Collaborate with executive team to understand the organisation's goals and strategy related to staffing, recruiting, and retention.
- Plan, lead and develop policies, processes, training, and initiatives to support the organisation's human resource compliance and strategy needs.
- Administer and oversee the administration of human resource programs including, but not limited to, compensation, benefits, and leave; disciplinary matters; disputes and investigations; performance and talent management; productivity, recognition, and morale; work health and safety; and training and development.
- Identify staffing and recruiting needs; develops and executes best practices for hiring and talent management.
- Conduct research and analysis of organisational trends including review of reports and metrics from the organization's human resource information system (HRIS) – Workday
- Monitor and ensure the organisation's compliance with federal, state, and local employment laws and regulations, and recommended best practices; review and modify policies and practices to maintain compliance.
- Maintain knowledge of trends, best practices, regulatory changes, and apply this knowledge to communicate changes in policy, practice, and resources to upper management and ANZ team
- Develop and implement departmental budget.
- Facilitate professional development, training, and certification activities for all ANZ team

detailed_profile.position: Senior Talent Partner EMEA at Capri Holdings Limited (Versace, Jimmy Choo & Michael Kors)
detailed_profile.about: Capri Holdings Limited is a global fashion luxury group, consisting of iconic brands that are industry leaders in design, style and craftsmanship. Our brands cover the full spectrum of fashion luxury categories including women’s and men’s accessories, footwear and apparel as well as wearable technology, watches, jewelry, eye-wear and a full line of fragrance products. The goal of our company is to continue to extend the global reach of our brands while ensuring that they maintain their independence and exclusive DNA. Capri Holdings Limited is publicly listed on the New York Stock Exchange under the ticker CPRI.

detailed_profile.about: I'm a passionate software engineer with expertise in C/C++ and MySQL. I'm comfortable with Vim, Linux, and Git. My competitive coding journey includes achievements on Leetcode (500+), Interviewbit, Codeforces, and Codechef, where I've solved 1000+ programming problems and earned high ratings. I've comprehensive understanding of Data Structures, Algorithms, Operating System, Object-Oriented Programming, Computer Networks, Database Management System(MySQL) and software engineering methodologies. My project portfolio includes Quizania (React and Firebase), Shopsense (React, Express, MongoDB), and Sudoku (HTML, CSS, JavaScript). I'm a problem solver, an innovator, and a lifelong learner in the realm of software engineering. Connect with me on LinkedIn .

patents.title: The Multidimensional Machine Learning Data and User Interface Segment Tagging Engine Apparatuses, Methods and Systems (“MLUI”) - Cognitive Intelligence Cache
patents.description: The Multidimensional Machine Learning Data and User Interface Segment Tagging Engine Apparatuses, Methods and Systems (“MLUI”) transforms ambient condition data, sales data, user interface selections, cognitive intelligence question input inputs via MLUI components into project projections, campaigns, user interface visualizations, cognitive intelligence question output outputs. A cognitive intelligence (CI) datapoint identifier cache datastructure is generated, the CI datapoint identifier cache datastructure configured to comprise a category identifier and an entity segment identifier. A CI datapoint value cache datastructure is generated, the CI datapoint value cache datastructure configured to comprise a set of module datastructures, each module datastructure corresponding to a module identifier associated with the category identifier, each module datastructure comprising a set of metric datastructures, each metric datastructure corresponding to a set of calculated metrics. The generated CI datapoint identifier cache datastructure and the generated CI datapoint value cache datastructure are stored as a key-value pair.

patents.title: The Multidimensional Machine Learning Data and User Interface Segment Tagging Engine Apparatuses, Methods and Systems (“MLUI”) - Database Config
patents.description: The Multidimensional Machine Learning Data and User Interface Segment Tagging Engine Apparatuses, Methods and Systems (“MLUI”) transforms ambient condition data, sales data, user interface selections, cognitive intelligence question input inputs via MLUI components into project projections, campaigns, user interface visualizations, cognitive intelligence question output outputs. A category identifier selection is obtained via a category selection interface mechanism. Entity segment identifier selections are obtained via entity segment interface mechanisms. A set of visualization cognitive intelligence (CI) datapoint identifiers is determine as CI datapoint identifiers associated with each combination of a selected entity segment identifier, and the select category identifier. CI datapoint values corresponding to the set of visualization CI datapoint identifiers are retrieved from a NoSQL database configured to act as cache for generating visualizations based on metrics calculated using survey data. A visualization is generated using retrieved CI datapoint values.

patents.title: The Multidimensional Machine Learning Data and User Interface Segment Tagging Engine Apparatuses, Methods and Systems (“MLUI”) - Datapoint Identifiers
patents.description: The Multidimensional Machine Learning Data and User Interface Segment Tagging Engine Apparatuses, Methods and Systems (“MLUI”) transforms ambient condition data, sales data, user interface selections, cognitive intelligence question input inputs via MLUI components into project projections, campaigns, user interface visualizations, cognitive intelligence question output outputs. An update to a survey data file is detected. The updated data is stored in a SQL database configured to utilize a composite index of the updated survey data that optimizes the database query time. A set of affected entity segment identifiers is determined. A set of affected category identifiers is determined. A set of the affected cognitive intelligence (CI) datapoint identifiers is determined as CI datapoint identifiers associated with each combination of an affected entity segment identifier and an affected category identifier. Metrics for each allowable response question identifier are calculated and stored in a NoSQL database configured to act as cache for generated visualizations

positions.description: Capri Holdings Limited is a global fashion luxury group, consisting of iconic brands that are industry leaders in design, style and craftsmanship. Our brands cover the full spectrum of fashion luxury categories including women’s and men’s accessories, footwear and apparel as well as wearable technology, watches, jewelry, eye-wear and a full line of fragrance products. The goal of our company is to continue to extend the global reach of our brands while ensuring that they maintain their independence and exclusive DNA. Capri Holdings Limited is publicly listed on the New York Stock Exchange under the ticker CPRI.

detailed_profile.name: Sakshi Tanwar
detailed_profile.position: Software Engineer at Capri Global Capital Ltd. | 2nd Position in BNY Mellon Code-Divas'24 | Flipkart Grid 5.0 Semi-Finalist | Google Girl Hackathon '23 Semi-Finalist
detailed_profile.about: I'm a passionate software engineer with expertise in C/C++ and MySQL. I'm comfortable with Vim, Linux, and Git. My competitive coding journey includes achievements on Leetcode (500+), Interviewbit, Codeforces, and Codechef, where I've solved 1000+ programming problems and earned high ratings. I've comprehensive understanding of Data Structures, Algorithms, Operating System, Object-Oriented Programming, Computer Networks, Database Management System(MySQL) and software engineering methodologies. I've advanced to Semi-Final in Google Girl Hackathon 2023 and Flipkart Grid 5.0. I'm currently pursuing an IT degree at IIIT Allahabad with a CGPA of 8.28. My project portfolio includes Quizania (React and Firebase), Shopsense (React, Express, MongoDB), and Sudoku (HTML, CSS, JavaScript). I'm a problem solver, an innovator, and a lifelong learner in the realm of software engineering. Connect with me on LinkedIn .

detailed_profile.name: Rishabh Singal
detailed_profile.position: SWE @ Capri Global Capital Ltd. | IIIT ALLAHABAD
detailed_profile.about: Software Engineer with 1+ years of professional experience building scalable backend systems and observability solutions. Strong foundation in Information Technology, distributed systems, backend development (FastAPI/Python), and database design; proven track record of reducing latency and automating workflows.

experience.title: Software Engineer
experience.description:
I played a key role in transforming the software landscape at Capri Global Capital Ltd. through innovative solutions and optimizations.  


• Built and launched the Quick Topup loan journey and salaried home loan journey, enhancing user experience and operational efficiency.  

• Resolved critical incidents in legacy services, implementing monitoring tools that reduced MTTR by 50%.  

• Optimized APIs by offloading tasks to background jobs, significantly improving performance and reliability.
experience.description_html:
I played a key role in transforming the software landscape at Capri Global Capital Ltd. through innovative solutions and optimizations.

• Built and launched the Quick Topup loan journey and salaried home loan journey, enhancing user experience and operational efficiency.
• Resolved critical incidents in legacy services, implementing monitoring tools that reduced MTTR by 50%.
• Optimized APIs by offloading tasks to background jobs, significantly improving performance and reliability.

experience.title: Software Engineer Intern
experience.description:
• Developed and delivered 20+ Change Requests by writing clean, testable Python code

• Collaborated with support and SRE teams to resolve over 60 tickets monthly, enhancing operational efficiency.  

• Utilized logging, metrics, and distributed tracing to reduce ticket turnaround time from 4 days to 1 day.

matched.match_rationale: Pulkit's role as a Data Analyst-Operations Executive has some overlap with Rozi's skills in data-related tasks.

detailed_profile.name: Pulkit kaushik
detailed_profile.position: Data Analyst- Operations Executive at Capri Global Capital Limited MBA From Maharshi Dayanand University
detailed_profile.about: I am an operations professional with expertise in data handling and MIS report generation. I maintain a professional approach to my work and constantly seek opportunities to learn, grow, and upgrade my skills. I believe challenges are opportunities for growth, and embracing workloads helps me deliver results and stand out. Passionate about data management and performance analysis, I focus on accuracy, efficiency, and adding value to every task I handle. I am always eager to learn new tools and technologies to enhance my contributions and drive organizational success.

experience.title: Data Analyst - Operations executive
experience.description:
- Worked with CarLelo, a venture of Capri Global Capital Limited, managing dealer data from various brand websites.  


- Handled dealer closures, new openings, and maintained accurate price lists and PAN India bank data.  


- Coordinated with dealers to update and verify details, ensuring data accuracy.  


- Assisted customers via chatbots, providing solutions and resolving queries.  


- Transitioned to Capri Global Capital Limited in November 2024, taking on additional responsibilities.  


- Generated and maintained MIS reports for performance analysis and business tracking.  


- Managed data for the luxury segment, ensuring accuracy and consistency.  


- Performed cross-checking and data validation to maintain reporting accuracy.
experience.description_html:
- Worked with CarLelo, a venture of Capri Global Capital Limited, managing dealer data from various brand websites.

- Handled dealer closures, new openings, and maintained accurate price lists and PAN India bank data.

- Coordinated with dealers to update and verify details, ensuring data accuracy.

- Assisted customers via chatbots, providing solutions and resolving queries.

- Transitioned to Capri Global Capital Limited in November 2024, taking on additional responsibilities.

- Generated and maintained MIS reports for performance analysis and business tracking.

- Managed data for the luxury segment, ensuring accuracy and consistency.

- Performed cross-checking and data validation to maintain reporting accuracy.

experience.title: Operations Executive
experience.description:
- Proficient in Excel, handling data entry and MIS Report. 


-	Ensured accuracy and efficiency in data processing tasks. 


-	Collaborated with team members to streamline data-related processes. 


-	Maintained organized and updated records.

detailed_profile.about: I'm a passionate software engineer with expertise in C/C++ and MySQL. I'm comfortable with Vim, Linux, and Git. My competitive coding journey includes achievements on Leetcode (500+), Interviewbit, Codeforces, and Codechef, where I've solved 1000+ programming problems and earned high ratings. I've comprehensive understanding of Data Structures, Algorithms, Operating System, Object-Oriented Programming, Computer Networks, Database Management System(MySQL) and software engineering methodologies. I've advanced to Semi-Final in Google Girl Hackathon 2023 and Flipkart Grid 5.0. I'm currently pursuing an IT degree at IIIT Allahabad with a CGPA of 8.28. My project portfolio includes Quizania (React and Firebase), Shopsense (React, Express, MongoDB), and Sudoku (HTML, CSS, JavaScript). I'm a problem solver, an innovator, and a lifelong learner in the realm of software engineering. Connect with me on LinkedIn .

recommendations: Dolev Farhi “Tarun is one of the most humble, capable, and gets things done managers I have encountered while working at Paytm. Security would have been a much easier job if all managers had Tarun's characteristics. I wish nothing but success to Tarun and hope to run into more people like him in my career down the road.”

Vivek Gupta “Tarun was my direct manager at Quad Analytix, and we used to work upon solving quality and performance issues at Quad, before that we used to have a common group at Adobe too. He has a brilliant knack of understanding the root of problem and working on them and his suggestions on plan executions and delivery used to be very insightful. He brings a vast experience in performance engineering and SAAS delivery to the table and it is still a pleasure to connect with him over various challenges in industry. He will definitely be a great catch for anyone looking forward to building robust pipelines.”

recommendations: Itisha Sharma “I am delighted to provide a LinkedIn recommendation for Mehak, whom I had the pleasure of working with during her tenure at Reality Business Intelligence Pvt. Ltd. She is an exceptional professional with a strong background in talent acquisition and human resources. Her dedication and expertise have been instrumental in driving the growth and success of the organization. She has demonstrated outstanding leadership skills. Furthermore, her ability to identify and attract top talent directly has been exemplary. She possesses a deep understanding of the talent market, having carried out comprehensive market mapping and providing valuable market intelligence to support business lines. Moreover, her commitment to fostering a positive work environment is commendable. Overall, Mehak is a highly motivated and skilled professional, possessing an exceptional ability to strategize and execute talent acquisition initiatives that align with the organization's goals. I wholeheartedly recommend her for any role where talent management and acquisition are pivotal to success. It was a pleasure collaborating with Mehak, and I am confident that she will continue to make significant contributions to any organization she becomes a part of.”

I will surely look forward to work with you in the future. Best of luck for all your future endeavours. Keep doing well Mehak!!!”

detailed_profile.about: Trusted HR leader in a complex global business; successfully managing stakeholders and competing priorities across regions to deliver organisational change and significant growth in ANZ. I diligently align & adapt global objectives and strategy to ensure compliance with Australia & New Zealand legislation. My passion lies in coaching and promoting ideas for business growth and value-add initiatives with the aim to create a unique and impactful people experience.

current_company.name: Capri Holdings Limited
current_company.title: Human Resources Manager, Australia & New Zealand

experience.title: Human Resources Manager, Australia & New Zealand
experience.description:
Head of Human Resources function for Australia & New Zealand.


-	Collaborate with executive team to understand the organisation's goals and strategy related to staffing, recruiting, and retention.

-	Plan, lead and develop policies, processes, training, and initiatives to support the organisation's human resource compliance and strategy needs.

-	Administer and oversee the administration of human resource programs including, but not limited to, compensation, benefits, and leave; disciplinary matters; disputes and investigations; performance and talent management; productivity, recognition, and morale; work health and safety; and training and development.

-	Identify staffing and recruiting needs; develops and executes best practices for hiring and talent management.

-	Conduct research and analysis of organisational trends including review of reports and metrics from the organization's human resource information system (HRIS) – Workday

-	Monitor and ensure the organisation's compliance with federal, state, and local employment laws and regulations, and recommended best practices; review and modify policies and practices to maintain compliance.

-	Maintain knowledge of trends, best practices, regulatory changes, and apply this knowledge to communicate changes in policy, practice, and resources to upper management and ANZ team

-	Develop and implement departmental budget.

-	Facilitate professional development, training, and certification activities for all ANZ team

Head of Human Resources function for Australia & New Zealand.

positions.title: HR Generalist
positions.description_html:
Recruitment
• Complete job postings and modifying to increase applicant flow
• Utilize tools, resources, and networks to attract top talent for all levels of the organization.
• Experience with completing phone screens and in-person interviews for potential candidates.
• Communicate feedback and providing recommendations to the hiring manager.
• Experience with building and delivering, and negotiating job offers.

Employee Relations
• Experience with conducting confidential internal investigations of behavioral and performance concerns for all levels of the organization.
• Ability to present key facts of an investigation to leadership.
• Coach managers through the organizations progressive discipline procedure

Safety/Risk Management
• Lead the organizations safety committee
• Manage worker’s compensation and leave programs for the organization, including incident reporting, leave of absences (FMLA, and non-FMLA)
• Oversee employees requiring modified activity
• Participate in quarterly claims reviews
• Investigate work injuries and communicates recommendations to leadership, reducing companies injury claims,
• Conducts mock OSHA audits for all organization communities
• Implement safety policies and procedures
• Complete all OSHA, and Sharps logs.

detailed_profile.position: Human Resources Manager - Australia & New Zealand at Capri Holdings Limited
detailed_profile.about: Trusted HR leader in a complex global business; successfully managing stakeholders and competing priorities across regions to deliver organisational change and significant growth in ANZ. I diligently align & adapt global objectives and strategy to ensure compliance with Australia & New Zealand legislation. My passion lies in coaching and promoting ideas for business growth and value-add initiatives with the aim to create a unique and impactful people experience.

current_company.name: Capri Holdings Limited
current_company.title: Human Resources Manager, Australia & New Zealand

experience.title: Human Resources Manager, Australia & New Zealand
experience.description:
Head of Human Resources function for Australia & New Zealand.


-	Collaborate with executive team to understand the organisation's goals and strategy related to staffing, recruiting, and retention.

-	Plan, lead and develop policies, processes, training, and initiatives to support the organisation's human resource compliance and strategy needs.

-	Administer and oversee the administration of human resource programs including, but not limited to, compensation, benefits, and leave; disciplinary matters; disputes and investigations; performance and talent management; productivity, recognition, and morale; work health and safety; and training and development.

-	Identify staffing and recruiting needs; develops and executes best practices for hiring and talent management.

-	Conduct research and analysis of organisational trends including review of reports and metrics from the organization's human resource information system (HRIS) – Workday

-	Monitor and ensure the organisation's compliance with federal, state, and local employment laws and regulations, and recommended best practices; review and modify policies and practices to maintain compliance.

-	Maintain knowledge of trends, best practices, regulatory changes, and apply this knowledge to communicate changes in policy, practice, and resources to upper management and ANZ team

-	Develop and implement departmental budget.

-	Facilitate professional development, training, and certification activities for all ANZ team
experience.description_html:
Head of Human Resources function for Australia & New Zealand.

- Collaborate with executive team to understand the organisation's goals and strategy related to staffing, recruiting, and retention.
- Plan, lead and develop policies, processes, training, and initiatives to support the organisation's human resource compliance and strategy needs.
- Administer and oversee the administration of human resource programs including, but not limited to, compensation, benefits, and leave; disciplinary matters; disputes and investigations; performance and talent management; productivity, recognition, and morale; work health and safety; and training and development.
- Identify staffing and recruiting needs; develops and executes best practices for hiring and talent management.
- Conduct research and analysis of organisational trends including review of reports and metrics from the organization's human resource information system (HRIS) – Workday
- Monitor and ensure the organisation's compliance with federal, state, and local employment laws and regulations, and recommended best practices; review and modify policies and practices to maintain compliance.
- Maintain knowledge of trends, best practices, regulatory changes, and apply this knowledge to communicate changes in policy, practice, and resources to upper management and ANZ team
- Develop and implement departmental budget.
- Facilitate professional development, training, and certification activities for all ANZ team

positions.subtitle: Capri Senior Communities
positions.description: • Aligns business objectives with employees and management in designated regional communities. • Consults with management, providing HR guidance when appropriate. • Analyzes trends and metrics in partnership with the HR group to develop solutions, programs, and procedures. • Manages and resolves complex employee relations issues. Conducts effective, thorough, and objective investigations. • Maintains in-depth knowledge of legal requirements related to day-to-day management of employees, reducing legal risks and ensuring regulatory compliance. • Provides day-to-day performance management guidance to management, such as coaching, counselling, career development, and disciplinary actions. • Works closely with management to improve work relationships, build morale, and increase productivity and retention. • Provides guidance and input on community restructures, and workforce planning and succession • Oversees Workers Compensation, FMLA, and all leaves of absence • Identifies training needs for community and individual executive coaching needs • Participates in evaluation and monitoring of training programs to ensure success. Follows up to ensure training objectives are met. • Manages community recruitment needs, develops relationships with organizations and schools regarding placement programs. • Provides HR policy guidance and interpretation

• Aligns business objectives with employees and management in designated regional communities.
• Consults with management, providing HR guidance when appropriate.
• Analyzes trends and metrics in partnership with the HR group to develop solutions, programs, and procedures.
• Manages and resolves complex employee relations issues. Conducts effective, thorough, and objective investigations.

positions.subtitle: Capri Communities LLC
positions.description: Recruitment • Complete job postings and modifying to increase applicant flow • Utilize tools, resources, and networks to attract top talent for all levels of the organization. • Experience with completing phone screens and in-person interviews for potential candidates. • Communicate feedback and providing recommendations to the hiring manager. • Experience with building and delivering, and negotiating job offers. • Guide newly hired candidates through onboarding. Employee Relations • Experience with conducting confidential internal investigations of behavioral and performance concerns for all levels of the organization. • Ability to present key facts of an investigation to leadership. • Coach managers through the organizations progressive discipline procedure Safety/Risk Management • Lead the organizations safety committee • Manage worker’s compensation and leave programs for the organization, including incident reporting, leave of absences (FMLA, and non-FMLA) • Oversee employees requiring modified activity • Participate in quarterly claims reviews • Investigate work injuries and communicates recommendations to leadership, reducing companies injury claims, • Conducts mock OSHA audits for all organization communities • Implement safety policies and procedures • Complete all OSHA, and Sharps logs.
positions.title: HR Generalist
positions.description_html:
Recruitment
• Complete job postings and modifying to increase applicant flow
• Utilize tools, resources, and networks to attract top talent for all levels of the organization.
• Experience with completing phone screens and in-person interviews for potential candidates.
• Communicate feedback and providing recommendations to the hiring manager.
• Experience with building and delivering, and negotiating job offers.
• Guide newly hired candidates through onboarding.

Employee Relations
• Experience with conducting confidential internal investigations of behavioral and performance concerns for all levels of the organization.
• Ability to present key facts of an investigation to leadership.
• Coach managers through the organizations progressive discipline procedure

Safety/Risk Management
• Lead the organizations safety committee
• Manage worker’s compensation and leave programs for the organization, including incident reporting, leave of absences (FMLA, and non-FMLA)
• Oversee employees requiring modified activity
• Participate in quarterly claims reviews
• Investigate work injuries and communicates recommendations to leadership, reducing companies injury claims,
• Conducts mock OSHA audits for all organization communities
• Implement safety policies and procedures
• Complete all OSHA, and Sharps logs.

recommendations: Itisha Sharma “I am delighted to provide a LinkedIn recommendation for Mehak, whom I had the pleasure of working with during her tenure at Reality Business Intelligence Pvt. Ltd. She is an exceptional professional with a strong background in talent acquisition and human resources. Her dedication and expertise have been instrumental in driving the growth and success of the organization. She has demonstrated outstanding leadership skills. Furthermore, her ability to identify and attract top talent directly has been exemplary. She possesses a deep understanding of the talent market, having carried out comprehensive market mapping and providing valuable market intelligence to support business lines. Moreover, her commitment to fostering a positive work environment is commendable. Overall, Mehak is a highly motivated and skilled professional, possessing an exceptional ability to strategize and execute talent acquisition initiatives that align with the organization's goals. I wholeheartedly recommend her for any role where talent management and acquisition are pivotal to success. It was a pleasure collaborating with Mehak, and I am confident that she will continue to make significant contributions to any organization she becomes a part of.”

Nikhil Subrahmaniyam “Mehak was a great hire to team North in Gold Loans buisness at IIFL during my days. One of my best team member. Her hardwork , dedication and sincerity towards work defines her as a professional. She has been a great support to her business team and they had always vouched for her performance. I will surely look forward to work with you in the future. Best of luck for all your future endeavours. Keep doing well Mehak!!!”

detailed_profile.about: At Capri Global Capital Ltd., my tenure as Associate Director and Joint Credit Head has been marked by a relentless pursuit of operational excellence through digital innovation. Our team's focus on integrating IT enhancements has revolutionized our approach, significantly optimizing processes and reducing risks in our urban retail and affordable housing portfolios. With expertise in business relationship management and credit analysis, we've cultivated an environment that prioritizes efficiency and strategic cost management. This dedication to excellence ensures that we not only meet but exceed the financial needs and expectations of our clients, fostering enduring partnerships and securing our position at the forefront of the financial services industry.

positions.description: Capri Holdings Limited is a global fashion luxury group, consisting of iconic brands that are industry leaders in design, style and craftsmanship. Our brands cover the full spectrum of fashion luxury categories including women’s and men’s accessories, footwear and apparel as well as wearable technology, watches, jewelry, eye-wear and a full line of fragrance products. The goal of our company is to continue to extend the global reach of our brands while ensuring that they maintain their independence and exclusive DNA. Capri Holdings Limited is publicly listed on the New York Stock Exchange under the ticker CPRI.

He will definitely be a great catch for anyone looking forward to building robust pipelines.”

I'm a problem solver, an innovator, and a lifelong learner in the realm of software engineering. Connect with me on LinkedIn .

detailed_profile.name: Amit Jain
detailed_profile.position: C.E.O @ Capri- Manufacturers of Automatic voltage Stabilizers / Regulators, servo Stabilizers | static converters I Trustee @ Medi- Dialysis Centre,a non profit organisation providing affordable health care I Mech. Engr.
detailed_profile.about: Capri means “playful & whimsical”. It is the impulsive determination that took shape in the year 1977 by our mentor and founder, Mr. Sushil Kr. Jain, with an intention of earning a livelihood, he planted the seeds of Capri by starting our first factory in Delhi. Since that time, we have advanced significantly and have become India's most prestigious and valued brand in the field of voltage stabilizers, with 4 manufacturing facilities, 10 branch offices, and 2000+ trusted and devoted business partners across India. As an ISO 9001:2008 & ISO 14001-certified organization, we encourage the finest manufacturing capabilities with automation, process controls, and standardization along with a dedicated R&D team of experienced professionals and industry leaders. Our brand Capri is synonymous with quality and honesty in business. Our traditional indian values of ethics, sincerity, and respect for our employees, partners, & associates, sets us apart. Capri is the market leader in the field of Voltage stabilizers, Servo voltage stabilizers, and Power conditioning equipment because of our constant drive to employ the latest technology with the sole intention of delivering the best value to our customers. Not limited to these, Capri has expertise in various power transformers, power supplies and special transformers for the varying needs of customers in commercial applications. Our 45 years of journey has been well acknowledged by various trade organizations, Govt bodies and industry magazines from time to time. List of some of the awards and recognition received over the years. 1. Udyog Patra Award in the year 1983 by the Vice President of India. 2. Best SME Award by Govt of Uttrakhand. 3. Institute of Trade & Industrial development silver jubilee Udyog Jyoti Award. 4. Published as the leader in the field of voltage stabilizers by outlook magazine. We are committed to deliver exemplary quality products by employing best techniques, new age technologies all but sustainable & eco friendly We have also forayed into export markets of the middle east, Nigeria, Egypt, Africa, Southeast Asia, CIS countries and Indian subcontinent. For further clarification, please feel free to contact us at 8929157901 or email us at info@capri.net.in . You can also visit us at www.capri.net.in

Her ability to navigate challenges, keep stakeholders engaged, and drive the project forward within the defined timeline was remarkable. She maintained a strong focus on process efficiency, ensuring a seamless transition to the new system while minimizing disruptions. Sue’s proactive communication, problem-solving mindset, and understanding of financial systems played a crucial role in the project’s success. Beyond her Project Management expertise, Sue is a results-driven leader who fosters a productive team environment. I would gladly work with her again and highly recommend her for any project requiring strong execution.”

Ruchi Tiwari “I have worked with Sue as a sourcing partner. Her attention to detail and sense of fairness is commendable. Her ability to handle conflict and negotiations in the most unassuming manner with a solution based approach is noteworthy. Apart from having a varied skill set in her portfolio, Sue will be an asset to any organisation just by virtue of her personality and positive outlook. ”

experience.title: Human Resources Manager, Australia & New Zealand
experience.description:
Head of Human Resources function for Australia & New Zealand.


-	Collaborate with executive team to understand the organisation's goals and strategy related to staffing, recruiting, and retention.

-	Plan, lead and develop policies, processes, training, and initiatives to support the organisation's human resource compliance and strategy needs.

-	Administer and oversee the administration of human resource programs including, but not limited to, compensation, benefits, and leave; disciplinary matters; disputes and investigations; performance and talent management; productivity, recognition, and morale; work health and safety; and training and development.

-	Identify staffing and recruiting needs; develops and executes best practices for hiring and talent management.

-	Conduct research and analysis of organisational trends including review of reports and metrics from the organization's human resource information system (HRIS) – Workday

-	Monitor and ensure the organisation's compliance with federal, state, and local employment laws and regulations, and recommended best practices; review and modify policies and practices to maintain compliance.

-	Maintain knowledge of trends, best practices, regulatory changes, and apply this knowledge to communicate changes in policy, practice, and resources to upper management and ANZ team

-	Develop and implement departmental budget.

-	Facilitate professional development, training, and certification activities for all ANZ team

positions.description: • Aligns business objectives with employees and management in designated regional communities. • Consults with management, providing HR guidance when appropriate. • Analyzes trends and metrics in partnership with the HR group to develop solutions, programs, and procedures. • Manages and resolves complex employee relations issues. Follows up to ensure training objectives are met. • Manages community recruitment needs, develops relationships with organizations and schools regarding placement programs. • Provides HR policy guidance and interpretation

positions.description: Recruitment • Complete job postings and modifying to increase applicant flow • Utilize tools, resources, and networks to attract top talent for all levels of the organization. • Experience with completing phone screens and in-person interviews for potential candidates. • Communicate feedback and providing recommendations to the hiring manager. • Experience with building and delivering, and negotiating job offers. • Guide newly hired candidates through onboarding. Employee Relations • Experience with conducting confidential internal investigations of behavioral and performance concerns for all levels of the organization. • Ability to present key facts of an investigation to leadership. • Coach managers through the organizations progressive discipline procedure Safety/Risk Management • Lead the organizations safety committee • Manage worker’s compensation and leave programs for the organization, including incident reporting, leave of absences (FMLA, and non-FMLA) • Oversee employees requiring modified activity • Participate in quarterly claims reviews • Investigate work injuries and communicates recommendations to leadership, reducing companies injury claims, • Conducts mock OSHA audits for all organization communities • Implement safety policies and procedures • Complete all OSHA, and Sharps logs.
positions.title: HR Generalist
positions.description_html:
Recruitment
• Complete job postings and modifying to increase applicant flow
• Utilize tools, resources, and networks to attract top talent for all levels of the organization.
• Experience with completing phone screens and in-person interviews for potential candidates.
• Communicate feedback and providing recommendations to the hiring manager.
• Experience with building and delivering, and negotiating job offers.
• Guide newly hired candidates through onboarding.

Employee Relations
• Experience with conducting confidential internal investigations of behavioral and performance concerns for all levels of the organization.
• Ability to present key facts of an investigation to leadership.
• Coach managers through the organizations progressive discipline procedure

Safety/Risk Management
• Lead the organizations safety committee
• Manage worker’s compensation and leave programs for the organization, including incident reporting, leave of absences (FMLA, and non-FMLA)
• Oversee employees requiring modified activity
• Participate in quarterly claims reviews
• Investigate work injuries and communicates recommendations to leadership, reducing companies injury claims,
• Conducts mock OSHA audits for all organization communities
• Implement safety policies and procedures
• Complete all OSHA, and Sharps logs.

experience.title: Associate
experience.description:
At CAPRI, I work across research, communications, and stakeholder engagement to advance policy innovation and institutional resilience in the Asia-Pacific. My bilingual role spans across project planning, senior fellow engagement, proposal pitching, research synthesis, and event management. 


Key Responsibilities


- Develop and pitch initiatives for CAPRI’s senior fellows, shaping opportunities for collaboration.


- Manage event design and execution, including CAPRI’s roundtables, internal activities such as the book club, covering logistical planning, coordination, and on-site delivery.


- Support research synthesis and project framing across CAPRI initiatives.


- Oversee operational workflows and process improvement, including budgeting, rundowns, and quality assurance for events, SOPs, and publications.


Key Accomplishments


- Part of the execution and successful delivery of CAPRI’s 2025 Annual Forum and co-led planning and execution for the Annual Dinner, including logistics coordination, entertainment planning, and on-site guest reception


- Served as CAPRI lead for the trilateral Copenhagen conference, managing planning, communications, and research-to-execution alignment


- Strengthened CAPRI’s student engagement pipeline through proposal review and targeted programming.


- Drafted and refined speeches, event proposals, and public communications that shaped CAPRI’s institutional voice.

experience.title: General Manager - UK
experience.description:
Member of European leadership team;

Built UK entity from ground up, responsible for total P&L delivery, building team (10 in total) and leading all local functions including sales, marketing and operations. 


Designed operating model, including sourcing logistics partners, DTC operators and all go to market commercials.


Created and led business development strategy across multiple sales channels. 


Key achievements - led marketing strategy that reached millions of people and enabled listings across multiple retailers and national foodservice chains within 12 months of the entity being created. Including Tesco, Morrisons, Ocado, Holland and Barratt, Planet Organic, David Lloyd, The Real Greek and many more.

experience.title: Human Resources Manager, Australia & New Zealand
experience.description:
Head of Human Resources function for Australia & New Zealand.


-	Collaborate with executive team to understand the organisation's goals and strategy related to staffing, recruiting, and retention.

-	Plan, lead and develop policies, processes, training, and initiatives to support the organisation's human resource compliance and strategy needs.

-	Administer and oversee the administration of human resource programs including, but not limited to, compensation, benefits, and leave; disciplinary matters; disputes and investigations; performance and talent management; productivity, recognition, and morale; work health and safety; and training and development.

-	Identify staffing and recruiting needs; develops and executes best practices for hiring and talent management.

-	Conduct research and analysis of organisational trends including review of reports and metrics from the organization's human resource information system (HRIS) – Workday

-	Monitor and ensure the organisation's compliance with federal, state, and local employment laws and regulations, and recommended best practices; review and modify policies and practices to maintain compliance.

-	Maintain knowledge of trends, best practices, regulatory changes, and apply this knowledge to communicate changes in policy, practice, and resources to upper management and ANZ team

-	Develop and implement departmental budget.

-	Facilitate professional development, training, and certification activities for all ANZ team
experience.description_html:
Head of Human Resources function for Australia & New Zealand.

- Collaborate with executive team to understand the organisation's goals and strategy related to staffing, recruiting, and retention.

- Administer and oversee the administration of human resource programs including, but not limited to, compensation, benefits, and leave; disciplinary matters; disputes and investigations; performance and talent management; productivity, recognition, and morale; work health and safety; and training and development.
- Identify staffing and recruiting needs; develops and executes best practices for hiring and talent management.

- Maintain knowledge of trends, best practices, regulatory changes, and apply this knowledge to communicate changes in policy, practice, and resources to upper management and ANZ team
- Develop and implement departmental budget.
- Facilitate professional development, training, and certification activities for all ANZ team

positions.subtitle: Capri Senior Communities
positions.description: • Aligns business objectives with employees and management in designated regional communities. • Consults with management, providing HR guidance when appropriate. • Analyzes trends and metrics in partnership with the HR group to develop solutions, programs, and procedures. • Manages and resolves complex employee relations issues. Conducts effective, thorough, and objective investigations. • Maintains in-depth knowledge of legal requirements related to day-to-day management of employees, reducing legal risks and ensuring regulatory compliance. • Provides day-to-day performance management guidance to management, such as coaching, counselling, career development, and disciplinary actions. • Works closely with management to improve work relationships, build morale, and increase productivity and retention. • Provides guidance and input on community restructures, and workforce planning and succession • Oversees Workers Compensation, FMLA, and all leaves of absence • Identifies training needs for community and individual executive coaching needs • Participates in evaluation and monitoring of training programs to ensure success. Follows up to ensure training objectives are met. • Manages community recruitment needs, develops relationships with organizations and schools regarding placement programs. • Provides HR policy guidance and interpretation
positions.title: Human Resources Business Partner
positions.description_html:
• Aligns business objectives with employees and management in designated regional communities.
• Consults with management, providing HR guidance when appropriate.
• Analyzes trends and metrics in partnership with the HR group to develop solutions, programs, and procedures.
• Manages and resolves complex employee relations issues. Conducts effective, thorough, and objective investigations.
• Maintains in-depth knowledge of legal requirements related to day-to-day management of employees, reducing legal risks and ensuring regulatory compliance.
• Provides day-to-day performance management guidance to management, such as coaching, counselling, career development, and disciplinary actions.
• Works closely with management to improve work relationships, build morale, and increase productivity and retention.
• Provides guidance and input on community restructures, and workforce planning and succession
• Oversees Workers Compensation, FMLA, and all leaves of absence
• Identifies training needs for community and individual executive coaching needs
• Participates in evaluation and monitoring of training programs to ensure success. Follows up to ensure training objectives are met.
• Manages community recruitment needs, develops relationships with organizations and schools regarding placement programs.
• Provides HR policy guidance and interpretation

positions.subtitle: Capri Senior Communities
positions.description: • Recruitment Lead for the organization, coordinate other HR team members on community recruitment. • Employee Relations lead, handle employee relations concerns at all levels of the organization, serve as resource to HR team members • Manages Safety and Worker's Compensation for the organization • Develops and maintains staff development plans, works with operations to enhance current procedures • Assists with monitoring, reporting, and analyzing company turnover and collaborates with other departments on designing and implementing retention programs • Manage compliance and enhance use of HR systems.
positions.title: Senior HR Generalist
positions.description_html:
• Recruitment Lead for the organization, coordinate other HR team members on community recruitment.
• Employee Relations lead, handle employee relations concerns at all levels of the organization, serve as resource to HR team members
• Manages Safety and Worker's Compensation for the organization
• Develops and maintains staff development plans, works with operations to enhance current procedures
• Assists with monitoring, reporting, and analyzing company turnover and collaborates with other departments on designing and implementing retention programs
• Manage compliance and enhance use of HR systems.

positions.subtitle: Capri Communities LLC
positions.description: Recruitment • Complete job postings and modifying to increase applicant flow • Utilize tools, resources, and networks to attract top talent for all levels of the organization. • Experience with completing phone screens and in-person interviews for potential candidates. • Communicate feedback and providing recommendations to the hiring manager. • Experience with building and delivering, and negotiating job offers. • Guide newly hired candidates through onboarding. Employee Relations • Experience with conducting confidential internal investigations of behavioral and performance concerns for all levels of the organization. • Ability to present key facts of an investigation to leadership. • Coach managers through the organizations progressive discipline procedure Safety/Risk Management • Lead the organizations safety committee • Manage worker’s compensation and leave programs for the organization, including incident reporting, leave of absences (FMLA, and non-FMLA) • Oversee employees requiring modified activity • Participate in quarterly claims reviews • Investigate work injuries and communicates recommendations to leadership, reducing companies injury claims, • Conducts mock OSHA audits for all organization communities • Implement safety policies and procedures • Complete all OSHA, and Sharps logs.
positions.title: HR Generalist
positions.description_html:
Recruitment
• Complete job postings and modifying to increase applicant flow
• Utilize tools, resources, and networks to attract top talent for all levels of the organization.
• Experience with completing phone screens and in-person interviews for potential candidates.
• Communicate feedback and providing recommendations to the hiring manager.
• Experience with building and delivering, and negotiating job offers.
• Guide newly hired candidates through onboarding.

Employee Relations
• Experience with conducting confidential internal investigations of behavioral and performance concerns for all levels of the organization.
• Ability to present key facts of an investigation to leadership.
• Coach managers through the organizations progressive discipline procedure

Safety/Risk Management
• Lead the organizations safety committee
• Manage worker’s compensation and leave programs for the organization, including incident reporting, leave of absences (FMLA, and non-FMLA)
• Oversee employees requiring modified activity
• Participate in quarterly claims reviews
• Investigate work injuries and communicates recommendations to leadership, reducing companies injury claims,
• Conducts mock OSHA audits for all organization communities
• Implement safety policies and procedures
• Complete all OSHA, and Sharps logs.

detailed_profile.name: Vaibhav Shah
detailed_profile.position: Associate Director - Head Credit | Business Relationship Management | Digital Transformation
detailed_profile.about: At Capri Global Capital Ltd., my tenure as Associate Director and Joint Credit Head has been marked by a relentless pursuit of operational excellence through digital innovation. Our team's focus on integrating IT enhancements has revolutionized our approach, significantly optimizing processes and reducing risks in our urban retail and affordable housing portfolios. With expertise in business relationship management and credit analysis, we've cultivated an environment that prioritizes efficiency and strategic cost management. This dedication to excellence ensures that we not only meet but exceed the financial needs and expectations of our clients, fostering enduring partnerships and securing our position at the forefront of the financial services industry.

experience.description:
Managed the West region for the T-Mobile account through product trainings, daily field

support and event planning. Developed key relationships with T-Mobile employees and owners of indirect stores to put Motorola ahead of competitors with exclusive advertising and presence at key events. Successfully planned and executed 10 large launch events for the V300 and V600 product launch with attendance totaling 1,000.
